relation: Great for these types of students
Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
Security is always there when you needed them and do an amazing job.

Greek life and CAB seem to be the best options in organizations. The football games are extraordinarily hype, the Misster ULM pageant is hilarious and the big concert at the end of the year is always memorable
Oozeball and the Misster ILM pageants.
There are parties, a recreational center, and always fun activities going on on-campus.
Home-style Louisiana food for those who love it, but also many other options such as Subway, and Chick Fil-A for those times when you want fast food.
The dorms are a very decent size and look very well-kept.
It's not a party school nor babysitting service. Your teachers will teach you whatever you need to know but you are responsible for your own success.

The University of Louisiana at Monroe has a medium sized campus compared to other colleges. The population is very diverse which lowers typical minority attendance stereotypes. It gives off a very comfortable vibe, with very friendly students and staff making you feel like you belong there.
pageTitle: University of Louisiana at Monroe Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {50037=There are always activities to participate in. ULM is home to a nationally rank ski team and it is fun to watch the team skiing on the bayou. During Spring Fever, you can play Ooz Ball (volleyball in the mud), attend music concerts and other activities. The 2012 Spring Fever concert featured The Fray., 229381=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC}

textAfterTable: Login to rate or flag the reviews LaBrittany from Junction City, AR 11/01/2010 Reviewer is A current student here. 5 out of 5 people found this review useful. 3 of 56 Categories Comments Great for these types of students ULM is GREAT for all types of students! It is so diverse and there is always something for everybody! Tips for prospective students College is a great experience... just do not forget why you are here. Reading in your textbooks is a major bonus. Also, utilize your teacher/professor's office hours. (: Bang for the buck It is definitely a bang for your buck. You get access to everything: activity center, student success center, tutors, etc. Am enjoying being here I no longer live on campus but I still enjoy being on campus as much as I did when I was living on campus. Campus life is always buzzing.
